## Natural history notes

Also called silver dwarf morning-glory, silky evolvulus (Evolvulus sericeus) is a native herbaceous plant found in many states in the southern US. While this species has been found in both wetland and upland areas, they typically are found mostly in dry areas. It is often recognized by its small white flower, and leaves are smooth on the top and hairy on the bottom.
